Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
off-key \off-key\ adj. & adv. Deviating from the proper pitch; -- of a musical note or series of notes; as, an off-key note; to sing off-key.
Syn: false, sour. [WordNet 1.5]
off-key adj : inaccurate in pitch; "a false (or sour) note"; "her singing was off key" [syn: {false}, {sour}]
